snippet: As it inches into e-commerce, Google is now charging retailers to appear on its site, a move it says will improve product listings.
abstract: Google and Amazon.com are waging war behind the scenes to become the pre-eminent online mall, and e-commerce sites large and small are being affected; Google is inching into e-commerce, and charging retailers to appear on its site, move it says will improve product listings; product searches on Amazon have grown 73 percent over the last year.

byline.original: By CLAIRE CAIN MILLER and STEPHANIE CLIFFORD

lead_paragraph: As it inches into e-commerce, Google is now charging retailers to appear on its site, a move it says will improve product listings.

headline.seo: Google Charges Retailers to Appear on Shopping Site
headline.main: Google Struggles to Unseat Amazon as the Web’s Most Popular Mall
headline.print_headline: Google Struggles to Unseat Amazon as the Web’s Most Popular Mall
